The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are narrowly lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellowish to brownish in color. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Oligolepis sprunnera is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
